org.jpc.query

Class Cursor<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpc.query.Cursor<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Iterator<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CursorAdapter, CursorFilter, Query

    public abstract class Cursor<T>
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable, Iterator<T>
    Note: The class hierarchy of class Cursor will be redesigned after the coming release of Java8 supporting virtual extension methods
    Author:
    sergioc

      The default implementation for obtaining all the solutions consists on just making use of the existing next() method However, children could override this in case many calls to next() are more expensive that obtaining all the results of the query at once (e.g., a findall/3 query in Prolog)

      • oneSolution

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<T> oneSolution()
        This method will change to return a java.util.Optional when Java8 is ready
        Returns:
        an Optional value with the first solution. Empty means that there are no solutions.

      • basicOneSolutionOrThrow

        protected T basicOneSolutionOrThrow()

      • nSolutions

        public List<T> nSolutions(long n)
        Parameters:
        n - the number of solutions the method should return or until exhaustion of the solutions (whatever happens first).
        Returns:
        is the first n solutions

      • solutionsRange

        public List<T> solutionsRange(long from,
                     long to)
        Parameters:
        from - the (0-based) index (inclusive) of the first solution
        to - the (0-based) index (exclusive) of the last solution
        Returns:
        a list with the solutions starting from 'from' (inclusive) to 'to' (exclusive) or until exhaustion of the solutions (whatever happens first). If there are less than (from+1) solutions will return an empty List according to the indexes sent as parameters

      • allSolutions

        public List<T> allSolutions()

      • basicAllSolutions

        protected List<T> basicAllSolutions()
        The default implementation for obtaining all the solutions consists on just making use of the existing next() method However, children could override this in case many calls to next() are more expensive that obtaining all the results of the query at once (e.g., a findall/3 query in Prolog)
        Returns:

      • iterativeAllSolutions

        protected List<T> iterativeAllSolutions()

      • isReady

        public boolean isReady()
        Returns:
        true if the cursor is ready, otherwise false.

      • isOpen

        public boolean isOpen()
        Returns:
        true if the cursor is open, otherwise false.

      • isExhausted

        public boolean isExhausted()

      • abort

        public void abort()
        Aborts execution. This method is not synchronized since it is supposed to be called from a thread different to the one currently executing a query
        Throws:
        InvalidCursorStateException - if the cursor is not open

      • isAbortable

        public abstract boolean isAbortable()

      • close

        public void close()
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        Answers if there are still rows in the cursor. This method may have effects on the state of the cursor. If the cursor is in READY state, it will change it to OPEN. If there are no more elements, it will change the state of the cursor to EXHAUSTED.
        Specified by:
        hasNext in interface Iterator<T>
        Returns:
        true if there are more solutions to the query, false otherwise.

      • next

        public T next()
        Answers the next solution.
        Specified by:
        next in interface Iterator<T>
        Returns:
        the next solution
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if there are no more elements in the cursor.

      • basicAbort

        protected abstract void basicAbort()

      • basicClose

        protected abstract void basicClose()

      • basicNext

        protected abstract T basicNext()
        Returns the next available element in the cursor. If the cursor is exhausted it should throw a NoSuchElementException the first time it is invoked. Its behavior is not specified if invoked more than once after the cursor has been exhausted.
        Returns:

      • finalize

        public void finalize()
        Overrides:
        finalize in class Object

        public void remove()
        Specified by:
